text: A MAN recumbent on the bed, playing a TRUMPET, his white defaced by a flower of blood.  The room is ON FIRE all ar He is playing Miles Davis' moody, Spanish-influenced SAET and lonely piece.
My name is Tom Van Allen ... (beat) or Danny Flynne ...

A DUFFLE BAG FULL OF MONEY ON THE BED.  The money burning pieces floating around the room. DANNY (cont'd) ... I don't know anymore. (beat) Maybe I'll let you decide.  Maybe you can help me, friend.  As you can see, I don't have a hell of a lot of time left.

A PHOTOGRAPH of a woman taped to the inside of a trumpet photo is on fire.  Only her smile remains. DANNY (cont'd) Avenging angel ... Judas Iscariot ... Loving husband ... Prodigal Son ... The prince of Denmark ...?

A GREETING CARD on the floor, a teddy bear and the word,  CONGRATULATIONS! on the front.  The wind from the fire bl open.  Inside, a BLACKENED BLOOD STAIN. DANNY (cont'd) All of these? None of these? You decide, friend.  You decide. Trumpet player? Speed freak? (beat) Speed freak. (beat) That's as good a place as any. (beat) But first, a little background on the mad world of the tweaker ..
EXTREME CLOSE-UP of a glass pipette dripping a clear liqu glass beaker.
Methedrene was first distilled by a Japanese scientist before WWII. Hand it to the Japanese, they knew a good thing when they saw it.
A wide-eyed, jaw-grinding KAMIKAZE PILOT with a death-gri controls.
This guy's so tweaked, he probably thinks he can survive this without a scratch.
STOCK BATTLE FOOTAGE - a Japanese Zero crashes into a bat bursting into a ball of flames.

Maybe not. (beat) By some estimates, 2% of the Japanese population had a meth problem after the war: factory workers, soldiers, pilots.  Maybe that's why it took two bombs to get 'em to surrender.  A nuclear blast is just a minor nuisance to a determined tweaker.
A wide-eyed, June Cleaveresque housewife in a picture-per dress vacuums the floor of a picture-perfect house.
In the fifties, the housewives got ahold of it.  Dexedrine. Benzedrine. Methedrene ...

She attacks the same spot over and over again, one hand c vacuum, the other stiffly holding a cigarette. DANNY (cont'd) Now that's a classic speed freak for you, skinny and cleaning the house.  I'll bet her poor husband never knew what hit him in the sack either.
THE LEG OF THE BED rattling and bouncing loudly off the f STOCK FOOTAGE - J.F.K. pumping the hand of NIKITA KRUSCHE
There were even rumors that one of our presidents dabbled with mysterious "energy shots".  Imagine that: a slammer in the White House.
Kennedy talking animatedly. DANNY (cont'd) If it's true, I'll bet ol' Krushchev never got a word in edgewise.
A sleepy-eyed TRUCKER emerges from his tractor-trailer an loitering HELL'S ANGELS-type.
By the late 60's the government finally cracked down and sent the whole thing underground.  Bikers controlled the market for a while.
The trucker gripping the wheel with the same death-grip a Kamikaze.
But now anyone with a basic chemistry kit and the right ingredients can cook it up at home.
A CASHIER scanning container after container of COLD MEDI
Ever see a long-haired tattooed freak buying up all the cold medicine he can lay his hands on at three in the morning.

The cashier looks up at the aforementioned FREAK, a froze plastered on his face. DANNY (cont'd) Take it from me, he ain't got no cold.  He's a cook.  Look in his kitchen and you'll find a whole grocery list of unsavory ingredients.
TRACK DOWN the kitchen counter on various containers.
Drain cleaner, hydrochloric acid, match heads for red phosphorus, ether and of course the cold medicine .. that's for Ephedrene, soon to become Methedrene
CONTINUE TRACKING to a series of BURNERS, BEAKERS and TUB DANNY (cont'd) This guy's a regular Julia Child. Problem is, I'll be even Miss Julia fucks up the bouillabaisse from time to time.
The freaky cook sees something he doesn't like. His eyes DANNY (cont'd) Oh-oh.
As the structure explodes.

Thick blankets and tinfoil taped over the windows. A huge container of empty beer cans, washed and neatly ar Lines of crystal meth on a mirror as precisely arranged a Nuremberg rally. A GROUP OF TWEAKERS in the middle of a binge. Two skinny women, NANCY and Teresa bent over a drawer-ful folded socks on the living room floor.  They stare at the they were pondering a Rembrandt.
It ain't right
You think?
Something's off.
We can do better.

They take the socks out and being rearranging them again. Three guys squeezed onto a couch together: KUJO, JIMMY TH CREEPER.  Kujo is talking a blue-streak.  He makes Dennis mealy-mouthed. Creeper and Jimmy stare straight ahead, clearly bugging.
So the alphabet, I mean look at it, there's 26 letters.  Why not 27 or 28 or 106?  And the vowels: a, e, i, o, u. What the hell is up with that?
And sometimes y.
What I'm saying is that I love it! It's great. I could go on all night about it.
And he does. KUJO (cont'd) Let's take every letter individually. I mean, let's really break the mother's down.
DANNY is sitting in an armchair.  He is the only one who He sits there, taking the scene in.

And so this is where I find myself. No. I should choose my words more wisely: this is the world I sought out.  The land of the perpetual night- party.  Day swallowing night and night swallowing day.  The crank compressing time like some divine piston on its awesome downstroke.

DANNY'S P.O.V. - SCANNING THE ROOM.  NO SOUND.  The girl' socks ... Kujo ranting on ... Creeper and Jimmy the Finn jaws ... the BLANKETS AND TINFOIL ON THE WINDOWS. DANNY (cont'd) We've been at this for three days ... or is it four?  Tweakerrs, lokers, slammers coming and going, swearing eternal allegiance and undying love for one another, only to wake up after the binge and realize you wouldn't walk across the street to piss on one of 'em if their head was on fire. (beat) Is it three days or is it four?

BACK ON DANNY. He blinks lethargically. DANNY (cont'd) I know what you're thinking. But don't give up on me just yet.  And for God's sake, don't pity me. Don't make any judgments until you've seen my whole story. (beat) And keep your eyes open. (beat) Nothing is what it seems.
Suddenly ...
OH SHIT! WE'RE OUT OF DRUGS!
Danny and Jimmy the Finn walking towards the front door.
How the hell did we get this detail?
Guess it's our turn.
Danny nods.
What time is it?
Twelve
Midnight?

As the door opens, Danny discovers that it is TWELVE NOON is blazing. The party house is revealed as a cheap stucco apartment b crammed in the middle of BUSY BUSINESS DISTRICT at a majo intersection. Jimmy and Danny slip on sunglasses and brave the light.
Where to?
I know a guy.
Lead the way.
They slink along like two albino rat vampires with sungla
Nice day
I hadn't noticed. (beat) I've seen you around.  What's your name?
Jimmy.  Everyone calls me Jimmy the Finn.
Why's that?
My features. They're Finnish.
You don't say.
Finland is a country.
Well, Jimmy the Finn, let's go score some gack.

Danny and Jimmy standing there looking at something OFF S and Jimmy looking at one another, then back at what they at. A GUY sitting on the bed in his underwear, looking down a and holding a can of BUG SPRAY at the ready in his right He is completely motionless, studying his arm with hypnot
Bobby?
Shhh.
Bobby never takes his eyes off his arm. BOBBY (cont'd) (whispering) They're coming.
(likewise whispering) What?
The spiders.
Bobby readies the can of bug spray, his eyes widening. BOBBY (cont'd) (sing-song) I'm ready for you this time.
Bobby lets loose with the spray, dousing his arm.
Aha! Yeah! (super rapid-fire) You thought you could fuck with Bobby, you thought you could fuck with Bobby, you thought you could fuck with Bobby!
Bobby's mouth wide with stupid joy and continues to cloud bug spray. BOBBY (cont'd) With Bobby you thought you could fuck?

Danny and Jimmy wait silently.  Bobby finally stops spray he has killed the imaginary spiders. He looks up at Jimmy and Danny, his eyes swimming with st addled confusion. BOBBY (cont'd) Who the fuck are you?
It's me ... Jimmy
Bobby squints.
Jimmy, Jimmy, Jimmy, Jimmy. Rhymes with Simmy.
Yeah.
What can I do for you?
Um, coupla' eight balls oughta do us.
Danny and Jimmy notice something simultaneously. There is something under the mattress - A HUGE BULGE.
Don't pay her no mind.
A MUFFLED MOAN from under Bobby.  She is between the matt box springs.  BOBBY (cont'd) Shut the hell up, goddamit!

Bobby starts slapping the top of the mattress with his ha MUFFLED SCREAMS from underneath. BOBBY (cont'd) I got no vocation skills!  What the fuck you want from me? (keeps slapping) I got no vocation skills!
Hey man, take it easy.
Bobby immediately stops.  Looks at Jimmy with incredulity
What?
Come on.  Ease off the girl.

Bobby springs from the bed, grabbing something as he rise Danny and Jimmy suddenly staring at a SPEARGUN which is l stainless steel spears. Bobby stands there alternately pointing the speargun at J Danny.
Did you bring the plastic men?
Bobby nods towards something behind Danny.  Danny and Jim or speak. BOBBY (cont'd) Did you bring the plastic men? (beat) Did you bring the plastic men?
Bobby rubs his nose.
Did ... you ... bring ... the ... plastic ... men?
Nah, we didn't bring 'em.  That's just your good crank talking, brother.
Bobby tilts his head. DANNY (cont'd) We were hoping to catch a few ourselves if you'll hook us up.
(calmer) You bring the plastic men?
Like I said.
Fuck man. Come on, Bobby.
Bobby, Bobby, Bobby.  Rhymes with ... (he draws a blank)
Hobby?
Bobby twists a smile, revealing speed-blackened teeth.
That's a good man. I like that.
(calmly) Hey, Bobby, look .. What you got going with your old lay, it's none of our business. We're just a couple of dope fiends trying to score.
Bobby lowers his speargun.
Two eight balls?
Jimmy breaths a sigh of relief.
Danny and Jimmy exit the room, closing the door behind th looks at Jimmy.
Nice dealer you got there, Jimmy.
Oh ... that.  Ah, he was just juiced. He wouldn't have did nothin'
WHAP, WHAP! Two spears plunge through the cheap door, sto from Danny's head. They run like hell.
TIME LAPSE.  The sun plunges down.  The sky turns black. races up and down.  The sky lightens.  The sun races up a Night comes again.

Everyone crashing.  Jonestown, post Kool-Aid.  It looks l all simultaneously fallen asleep where they were standing Danny stirs awake.  Looks around.  He stretches.  KNOCKIN BOTTLE OF BEER. ALL OTHER SOUND FADES OUT AS the beer SPLATTER to the flo UNNATURALLY LOUD. DANNY staring intently at the spilling liquid. The beer pools up on the floor. Danny transfixed by the image. The last few drops of beer LOUDLY splashing down.
Danny on the phone.
C.I. number 678-43K-107 (beat) Tanner and Garcetti
He hangs up.
Danny waiting in the shadows. A car, sans headlights, pulls into the alley and stops. Danny emerges from the shadows, opens the back door and l back seat.
Two guys in suits in the front, TANNER and GARCETTI.  Tan and SHAVED HEAD, an air of ex-military around him.  Garce and serious, a MIASMA OF BAD-ASS ATTITUDE.
(lying on the back seat) I've got a hot one.
You go, boy.
If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not dish right here in the middle of Crankville.
Tanner drives out of the alley.
Feeling the paranoia tonight, are we?
Well, you know what they say, just because you're paranoid, doesn't mean everyone's not out to slice your balls off and shove 'em down your throat.
Danny, Tanner and Garcetti outside the car in a deserted pacing.
You got a name?
Bobby, rhymes with hobby.
What?
Never mind.  Dude had a backfull of jailhouse tatts.
No last name?
It was all pretty informal.  Didn't have a lot of time to exchange pleasantries.
Garcetti produces something from the front seat of the ca over.
This the guy?
It speaks!
The humorless Garcetti hands Danny a "WANTED POSTER".  Bo glaring.
That's him.  He's a lot prettier in person though.
Cut to the fucking chase, Flynne.
Dude is bugging.  Transparent spiders, plastic men - the whole nine yards.
What's he holding?
Bobby's hand extracting the eightballs from a nylon bag f
Couple of eightballs, maybe more.
QUICK SHOT of an open drawer.  A GUN can be glimpsed insi DANNY (cont'd) Cheap ass techno knockoff in the drawer with extra mags.
ANOTHER QUICK GLIMPSE of the closet.  A shotgun butt visa DANNY (cont'd) 12 gauge in the closet.
Any company?
The WOMAN'S HAND protruding from underneath the mattress.
Alas, the lovely Mrs. Bobby was playing the bologna in a Posturpedic sandwich (beat) And there was a kid.
A SILHOUETTE visible through a crack in the BATHROOM DOOR
A kid?  Are you sure?
A BEAT-UP ELMO DOLL and SOME COLORING BOOKS on top of the
Back on Danny.
Yeah. Pretty sure. (beat) Oh yeah ... he had a spear gun, too.
God damn, Flynne, you are one observant tweaker.
Somebody has to help you lazy bastards.
Garcetti looks at Danny with contempt.  They head back to DANNY (cont'd) Hey Tanner ... you be careful, okay?
Danny, I'm touched.
Don't be. I'm worried about the kid.
Then why didn't you help the kid when you were there?
Hey, you want me to do all your work for you, numbnuts?
Garcetti throws Danny up against the car.  Nose-to-nose.
I'll tell you why you didn't help - because you're a chickenshit tweaking snitch.  You're a bottom feader, Flynne.
Garcetti, you're teeth, they're fucking perfect.
Garcetti lets Danny go. Stomps off.
You're welcome.

A GAGGLE OF ONLOOKERS, including a NEWS CREW, watching fr lot. BOBBY'S WOMAN screaming at the top of her lungs as she tr Bobby's sheet-covered body. A SWAT TEAM packing up nearby.  One of them suddenly does little Tai-Chi gesture. A LITTLE GIRL clutches at the screaming woman's legs. REVEAL DANNY, amongst the onlookers.  His expression give away. A ribbon of blood snakes from Bobby's body, over the park and runs into a storm drain. As the blood SPLATTERS to the bottom, mixing with a pool water. THE SOUND IS UNNATURALLY LOUD. INT. RESIDENTIAL HOTEL - GARDENA - NIGHT. The place cries out "YOU HAVE FINALLY HIT THE ABSOLUTE BO Danny exist the stairwell and approaches his door. A WOMAN ONE DOOR DOWN FROM DANNY'S ROOM struggles with he When she goes to open the door, one of the  bags breaks, contents onto the floor. Danny walks over.
(approaching) Let me help you with those.
She scoops up the groceries and hurries into her room.  S door behind her. DANNY (cont'd) (loud through the door) And to think Miss Manner was living down the hall from me and I didn't even know it!
There is a can on the floor.  Danny bends down to pick it DANNY (cont'd) Hey, you left a can of ...
He looks at the can.
The label is in CHINESE. DANNY (cont'd) ... some Chinese looking shit out here.
No reaction. DANNY (cont'd) I'll just leave it by the door here. (beat) I'm going now!
After a moment, the door swings open.  Danny is holding t with a big smile on  his face. DANNY (cont'd) You really oughta be more careful. This is not a good neighborhood.
The woman smiles.  A pretty smile.  Sad too.
I was rude. I'm sorry.  I'm kinda new around here.
You did the right thing. (handing the can over) What is this stuff anyway?
Fermented soybean curd.
Yummy.
She smiles again. World-weary.  Sweet. Those eyes.  Sad. and sexy. DANNY (cont'd) My name is Danny Flynne. (off her silence) And you are?
Colette Aragon. Thank you, Danny.
She closes the door abruptly.

The burning room from the opening scene.  Danny's dirty c bed. He emerges from the shower, a towel wrapped around his wa a BIG STAR-SHAPED SCAR on Danny's shoulder. He walks over to the closet, takes a METAL LOCKBOX from t and puts it on the bed. Pulls a key from his pocket and unlocks the box. He sits at the contents for a moment, then gingerly takes them ou ... CLOTHES.  A white dress shirt, black slacks and wingt

Danny dresses in his clothes, combing his hair.  He goes lock box and pulls something else out ... ... A TRUMPET CASE.  He walks over to the cheap vanity an front of the mirror and stars for a very long time.
My name is Tom Van Allen (beat) I play the trumpet.

He slowly opens the trumpet case revealing a GLEAMING HOR Runs his fingers along the length of it and up to ... ... A PHOTO OF A WOMAN taped to the inside of the lid.  A conscious smile on her face like she's uncomfortable with picture taken. DANNY (cont'd) (distant) My name is Tom Van Allen. I play the trumpet.
He takes the trumpet from the case - A CHECK from a LIFE COMPANY and a DRIVER'S LICENSE with Danny's picture and t VAN ALLEN. DANNY (cont'd) My name is Tom Van Allen and I play the trumpet.
He starts to play.  "Saeta" again. AN IMAGE appears on THE BLANK WALL BESIDE HIM.  MOVE OFF TO THE IMAGE. IN THE IMAGE - A HUGE LAKE in the middle of the DESERT. MOVING IN ON IMAGE AS WE CUT TO ...

Danny and THE WOMAN FROM THE PHOTOGRAPH sitting on the sh the sunset. She is his wife, LIZ. Danny playing "SAETA" on his trumpet. Danny and Liz are alone, except for the myriad birds, sil the falling sun. A gust of wind rushes across the lake, blowing Liz's hair her face. A dying fish on the waterline, gills pumping for oxygen. Danny finishes playing. Silence. IMPORTANT: DANNY WILL BE KNOWN AS TOM IN THIS SCENE.
That's so ... (not finishing the word)
Melancholy?
Yes, it hurts my heart.  What a beautiful composition.
And the performance?
(goofing) A virtuoso rendition.  TOM VAN ALLEN is nothing short of dazzling in his interpretation of Miles Davis' haunting, moody piece.
Thank you.  Thank you very much.
And he has a really hot ass with hardly any hair on it.
Again, I thank you.
I was talking about Miles.
Danny playfully tackles her to the ground.
You, madam, are a heartless wench.
And you've got wiener breath.
Really?
It's that disgusting hot dog you had for lunch.
Danny starts kissing her over and over again.
(laughing) Tom! Gross!
She finally pushes him off.  He rolls off of her and snug to her, spooning her in the sand.
You know how I make that song melancholy when I play it? I think of what my life would be like without you.
Liz smiles, snuggles closer to Danny.
Tom, let's spend the night here.
There's no motels around here.
No.  Right here on the beach.  Come on. Let's do it.
Danny sitting at the vanity holding the trumpet.  THE IMA PROJECTED ON THE WALL BEHIND HIM.
(at the vanity, whispering) Okay, we'll stay.  We'll stay.

head_text.subj: NOW THE DANNY IN THE IMAGE ANSWERS ....

text: (on the beach) Come on, Liz. We'll get eaten alive.
(at the vanity, softly) No ... We'll stay.

BACK ON THE IMAGE as Danny and Liz walk away from the sho The sun sinks completely below the horizon. A long fish hawk floats on the last of the thermals. The dying fish breaths its last. Danny (at the vanity) closes his eyes.
The trumpet goes back in the case. The lid is closed. The case goes back in the box. The neatly folded clothes are laid on top. The box goes back to the shelf. The light in the closet is turned off.

Danny and Tanner sitting across from one another at a pic Tanner writing serial numbers down as he counts out SEVER DOLLAR BILLS. Danny watching silently. Tanner puts the bills in an envelope, licks the flap, sea slides it over to Danny, who doesn't touch it. The envelope lays there between them for the following co
You think I'm a Judas?
Hard to compare the people you're taking down with the Lord.
Garcetti thinks I'm a pile of shit.
Garcetti thinks everything is shit. He doesn't even like dolphins.
Danny smiles. TANNER (cont'd) I'm serious.  He hates 'em.  You ever hear of anyone who didn't like dolphins?
Tanner shakes his head and smiles.
Thanks for not judging me.
It's not my place.
Don't you wonder why I do it?
The money? The drugs? Keeping yourself out of jail? I know the drill.
You don't find that repugnant?
Just the way the world works.  Look, as far as tweakers go, you aren't a bad guy.  You never hurt anyone but yourself as far as I know.
Tell that to Bobby ... and his wife and kid.

Bobby laid his own tracks.  He could have gone quietly but he played the hard-ass con till the end. And as far as I'm concerned, he wife and kid are a hell of a lot better off without him. (beat) Now take the money.
Danny stuffs the money into his jacket. TANNER (cont'd) One think I do want to know is how the hell did you get yourself into this position to start with?  You seem like a smart enough guy.
It's a long story.  Maybe I'll tell you all about it some day.
Garcetti emerges from the men's room, zipping up. DANNY (cont'd) Hey, Garcetti ... You ever get confused and try to flush yourself? Garcetti (all business) You tell him?
I was getting to it.
(to Tanner) Tell me what?
I'll tell him.
(worried) Tell me what?
Garcetti sits down next to Danny. Sighs.
(mock concern) Danny, it's really pains me to have to tell you this, but do you remember DOMINGO, that wetback you helped us put away for trafficking a few months back?
Yeah.  What about him?
Turns out he's connected.
To who?
The Mexicali Boys
And what does this have to do with me?
Garcetti puts his hand on Danny's shoulder, really playin
He knows somebody ratted him.
What?!
And he's making a lot of noise about having his homies hang a Colombian necktie on whoever it was.
Garcetti leans in close GARCETTI (cont'd) You know that thing where they slit your throat and pull your tongue out of the hole.

Danny knocks Garcetti's hand away and stands up.  Garcett GARCETTI (cont'd) Apparently they call it a necktie because it hangs down about yay long and looks very similar to a tie. Isn't that weird, Danny?  Isn't that weird?
Shut up, Garcetti!
Danny turns to Tanner
If he finds out it's me, I'm a dead man.
Danny, he isn't gonna find out it's you.  Domingo was a slinger, he must have sold to hundreds of different people.
Danny paces back and forth. TANNER (cont'd) And if you're that worried about it, maybe you ought to get out of town.
How the hell am I gonna do that?  You guys are still stringing me a long on that possession charge.
(mock surprise) You mean that hasn't been cleared up yet?
Garcetti chuckles at Danny's fear
Fuck you, Garcetti. I been at this for almost a year. I've done everything you guys have asked of me.
Anyone ever ask you to be such a disrespectful smart-ass all the time?
Look, we'll talk to the A.D.A.
When?
Soon. I promise.  We'll get the charges dropped and you can disappear.  In the mean time, trust me, he has no idea that you ratted him out.

Danny sitting cross-legged in front of a gravestone. A PICKUP TRUCK slowly winds its way up the access road to Danny stands up.  Dusts his pants off. The truck stops nearby.  The strains of GARTH BROOKS from Danny approaches.  The passenger's side window rolls down ... A BAD-ASSED ASIAN DUDE behind the wheel. He wears a c a rodeo belt.  He looks like the Chinese Marlboro man.  T An AIRBRUSH painting on the door panel - a bad likeness o astride a horse, dressed as a cowboy with a huge-breasted Anderson-type on the saddle behind him.
(checking out the painting) Ride 'em cowboy)
(southern twang) You like that?
Who wouldn't?
First rate, ain't it?
It's downright classy is what it is.
Bubba fires up a cigarette, revealing a pock-marked face. gun in a tooled leather shoulder holster. DANNY (cont'd) You consider my presentation?
Get in, hoss.  We'll talk it over.
Danny climbs in.  The window goes back up.  As the care p ... ... MOVE back over to the gravestone. The stone reads: "ELIZABETH VAN ALLEN.  BELOVED WIFE"
A non-descript. cinder block bar.  No windows.  No frills

Danny sitting at the bar, nursing a drink.  He looks nerv darting around for potential assassins. He has nothing to worry about with this crowd, harmless a Jimmy The Finn enters and approaches Danny.  Danny signal go to the back, then gets up and follows him, carrying tw
Jimmy, you don't look so hot.
Jimmy has dark circles under his eyes.
I'm hurting.
You on a roll?
Was.  I'm on the fucking ghost train right now, man.  You got anything for me?
Sorry.
Why does it have to feel so bad?
You're brain is in reverse mode ... cutting off your supply of dopamine. Here.  Have a beer.
Jimmy sighs, scratches his arms.  They are all scabbed up DANNY (cont'd) You see the crank bugs?
Oh yeah. (guzzles some beer) Man, Danny, how do you keep your shit together so tight?
Danny chuckles.
That's a good one.
I'm serious, dude.  You always seem to be on top of things, even when you're tweakin'.
I guess there's just no substitute for good genes.
Jimmy finishes his beer.  Danny signals to the cocktail w more beer. DANNY (cont'd) You hear about Bobby?
Yeah, it's a pity.  Truly a pity.
Danny smiles at Jimmy's choice of words. JIMMY (cont'd) He was a good supplier. (gets an idea) You think maybe there's any drugs left in his room?  You know, like hidden?
I kind of doubt it, Jimmy.
The beers arrive.  Jimmy lays into his, downing it in one Danny slides his over.
So, why'd you want to see me?
Business.  I need to leave town and I find myself in dire need of some cash.
See that?  That's just what I'm talking about.
What?
You. You're smooth. You use words like dire and shit.  You got language skills, man.
Don't get carried away.
I find myself in dire need of some cash.
Jimmy shakes his head in wonder.
You remember that guy you told me about ... said he could handle a big hook-up?
Yeah, Pooh-Bear.  Dude is a big-time cook. I'm talking dire.
I know a buyer.  Guy's looking for a quarter's worth.
Jimmy frowns.
A quarter?  Danny that ain't even worth ...
A quarter of a million, Jimmy.
Jimmy's a drug-addled eyes catch a glimmer.
Fuuuuuck
Can your man handle that?
I think so.  I mean, we'd have to talk to him.
Can you set that up?
Sure.
Jimmy sucks what's left of his beer down. JIMMY (cont'd) What's in it for us?
I'm getting a 10% finder's fee from my man if I can get the right price.
Jimmy becomes paralyzed by the math.
25 grand.  You introduce me to your boy, I'll cut you five grand out of my take.  That's all you gotta do, just get me in the door.

Danny walking home.  Sparse traffic on the street. He wal head down and his hands thrust in his pockets. A RED CAR approaches from the opposite direction. It SLOW Danny. Danny looks over. The DRIVER is obscured by the reflected glare of a street is obvious that he is staring right at Danny. Danny plays it cool. Keeps walking. The red car pulls a SLOW U-TURN. Danny hauls ass. The red car catching up. 7Danny runs down a service street which runs through the series of apartment complexes. The red car follows, slowly prowling the street. Danny squeezed behind a dumpster, watching. It is now too dark to see the driver.  The car comes to a Danny hugging the dumpster tight. Another car pulls into the tight street, behind the red c driver of the other car SOUNDS HIS HORN.  The red car spe Danny walks quickly the other way.

A WAY-TOO-YOUNG BLACK KID stares DIRECTLY AT CAMERA, an A HANDGUNS, KNIVES, RIFLES AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT spread ou dining room table before him. He is squeezed into a terry-cloth jumpsuit, his body fest gold jewelry, his hair all wet jerry-curl. He looks like Barry White, Jr.
Mister, I only deal in high-end weapons.  All guaranteed stolen and traceable only to their original owners.  All sales are final and all prices are negotiable.

The kid speaks in a HUSKY MONOTONE, completely FLAT and H sounds like one of those kids selling candy door-to-door memorized pitch told by rote. Danny steers the car onto the narrow dirt approach to the
First you want me to ask for directions, then you don't.  Which is it?
I wanted you to ask back there.  You know, before you got us lost.
Just no pleasing you, is there?
Just admit you're wrong.
We all know how much you like hearing that. Okay, Liz, I was wrong. There.  You happy?
Quit feeling sorry for yourself, Tom. It gets old.
No. You know what gets old? Being reminded what a loser you are every time you screw up.
Here it comes, poor Tom.
But that's okay, Liz, you're the one with the steady job, you pay all the bills. I'm just an unemployed musician.  You have every right.
That is so unfair.
Danny stares straight ahead, steering the car towards the
My sentiments exactly.
Why are you doing this?
Danny doesn't answer. LIZ (cont'd) I never once asked you to stop playing. I wouldn't dream of it. So don't take your low self-esteem out on me.
Danny continues to ignore her.
... Tom ... screw it.  Tell me when you're ready to apologize.
DANNY lying on the bed, reliving the moment.  THE IMAGE S ON THE WALL.
(on the bed, whispering) I'm sorry, Liz. I love you and I'm sorry.
But the DANNY IN THE IMAGE never answers.
It is raining buckets outside.  Danny sleeping soundly. The roof of Danny's room is leaking, PUDDLING UP ON THE F BED. Danny's eyes pop open. He lays there rigidly.  LISTENING

head_text.subj: ALL OTHER SOUND FADES OUT AS THE WATER PATTERS AND PUDDLE

text: The bar is almost empty. Danny quietly playing chords on a beat-up old upright pia of the room - the through-line of Davis' "All Blues."
This seat taken?
Danny looks up.
Oh. Hi.
What happened to your eye?
Turns out I'm allergic to steel-toed boots. Go figure. (beat) By the way, I'm not looking for a matching set. (off her puzzled look) Where's Quincey?
Don't worry. He's out of town.
How far out of town?
Trust me. We're safe.
Colette sits down on the piano bench next to Danny.  COLETTE (cont'd) Please keep playing.
He continues. She sits there listening for a few moments. COLETTE (cont'd) That's nice. What is it?
Miles Davis. "All Blues."
Never heard of him.
Just a fucked-up guy who played beautiful music.
Like you?
Nah. I'm strictly minor league... except for the fucked-up part.
Danny continues to play.
Dude played his soul right out the end of the horn. No false notes. Always honest.
And you admire that?
It's the only way to play.
Colette slides closer.
Is that how you play?
I try.
No false notes?
She pulls even closer.
No deep dark secrets?
She goes to kiss him. Danny stops playing. Pulls away fro
(cold and abrupt): What are you up to?
Nothing.
What do you want from me, Colette?
I don't want anything. Why are you so suspicious?
It gets me through the day.
You really need to lighten up.
She puts her hand on his leg.  COLETTE (cont'd) Just relax.
He moves his leg away.
Look, I can't help you with Quincey if that's what you're after.
This has nothing to do with him.
So you're just attracted to me, is that it?
Yes. Why do you find that so hard to believe?
How much time do you have?
What is wrong with you?
How much time do you have?
You've got a comeback for everything, don't you, Danny? You use 'em like some sort of shield.
Who the fuck are you? Dr. Joyce Brothers?
There you go again. You're nothing but false notes.
You don't like the tune, find another station.
What are you hiding, Danny?
Therapy session is over.
He closes the keyboard cover.
You think you're the only one down here with a sad story?
No. But I'm the only one with my sad story. (beat) And that's how it's gonna stay.

Still raining.  Tanner negotiates the slow traffic. Danny looking at a MUG SHOT OF POOH-BEAR. Garcetti Harlan Dale Monty a.k.a. Pooh-Bear. Did five years manslaughter for beating a pimp to death with an electric wheelchair.
Excuse me?
Several possession charges, but nothing major.
Why doesn't Palmdale P.D. just raid the guy?
They have. But they never found a lab.
That's because he doesn't have one.
Whata you mean?  He told me -
Guy scores dope and dollar from ripping off other drug dealers.  As least that's what the word is.
What's to stop him from just ripping me off then?
That's probably what he would have done if we hadn't found out about your get-rich-quick scheme.
You're lucky, Flynne.
Funny, I don't feel lucky.
We're coordinating with Palmdale P.D.. We'll have your sorry ass covered.
What if he caps me before you can make a move?
Golly, I hadn't thought of that.
Don't we always take good care of you?
Danny doesn't look reassured.
Speaking of which ... you run that license plate for me?
You mean the menacing red car?
Garcetti and Tanner exchange a smile.
What? Is it bad?
I'm afraid so, Danny.
Who is it?
Brace yourself.
Danny's eyes dart back and forth between Garcetti and Tan
Come on! Who is it?  Domingo's boys?
Worse. Much worse. (beat) A teacher.
Garcetti and Tanner break out laughing.
Car is registered to a Mrs. Nancy Plummer.
Danny reacts to the name, not listening to the rest of wh and Tanner have to say.
She's 57 and she's been teaching third grade for the last 33 years.
Now that's scary!
Danny lost in thought.
You're paranoid, Flynne.  I think that crank is finally starting to get the best of you.
Danny waiting on the corner.
When is the deal going down?
I'm making the small buy tonight ... if I don't get beaten to death with a wheelchair or something.  If everyone is happy, we'll do the big deal later in the week.

Jimmy's Vega sputters to a stop in front of Danny.  Jimmy hands Danny the keys. ON THE BUMPTER, a hand-made sign. It reads: PULL ME OVER. Danny sighs. Walks to the back, rips the sign off and get leaving Jimmy with the sign.
You sure you don't want me to go with you?
Danny burns rubber.
Danny being led towards a trailer by TWO OF POOH-BEAR'S M BILL AND BIG BILL. Little Bill is big and Big Bill is lit
Pooh-Bear sitting in a recliner, obscured by shadows when escorts enter.
obscured by shadows. Pooh-Bear doesn't look up. He is preoccupied with somethi which he is cleaning with a toothbrush.
Pooh-Bear, my man.  What's up?
Pooh-Bear doesn't respond. Continues brushing.
He's blue.
Comin' down from a 10 day ride.
Danny closes his eyes. Not what he wanted to hear.
You want to do this some other time?
(gloomy and tired) Pull your pants down.
I'm sorry?
Pull your motherfucking pants down.
Danny looks to the two Bills for help.
(laughing nervously) Come on, guys ...
Big Bill.
Big Bill pulls a 19th century double-barreled FLINTLOCK P jacket and points it at Danny's head.
Argh, matie. I'm a pirate.
Little Bill

Little Bill drops Danny's trousers.  Danny about to objec started into silence. The saturnine Pooh-Bear raises his head, illuminating his isn't wearing his prosthetic nose.  A GAPING HOLE WHERE H BE.  He looks like some obscene human bat. Pooh-Bear holds up the plastic nose he has been cleaning, under the light. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Introduce him to Captain Steubing.

He pops his nose back into place, but it goes on crooked. The Bills escort Danny over to the cage.  There is A GIGA WEASEL INSIDE. The cage is divided by a large piece of Plexiglas. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) You'll have to excuse him, he ain't ate for over a week.
The weasel is foaming at the mouth. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) That and the rabies.  Don't make for a happy weasel.
(trying to stay calm) Pooh-Bear. come on, man.  What is this? (off Pooh-Bear's silence) It's me, Danny. I thought we had a deal.
Big Bill Big Bill pushes Danny up to the cage, which comes up to a level.
Captain Steubing thinks you might work for the police.
What?!
Pooh-Bear holds up his hand.
Don't address me.  I didn't make the accusation.
Please .. I don't know what you're ...
Uh-uh-uh ...
He points to the cage.   Danny looks down at the weasel, trying to gnaw through the Plexiglas.
Jesus Christ. (to the weasel) Um ... I'm not .. Captain Steubing. I'm not working for the cops.
The weasel continues to gnaw.
He don't believe you. Big Bill.
Drop your package in the cage.
My what?
Put your pee-pee through the hole.
There is a hole in the top of the cage on the opposite si Plexiglas from Captain Steubing.
This is fucking crazy!
Big Bill pulls back the hammer on the gun.
Yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum.
Oh fuck ... oh Jesus ...
Danny's eyes dart quickly over to Little Bill, who like e is watching the weasel. Little Bill is wearing a big, filthy pea coat with A LARG side. Danny still hasn't complied with Pooh-Bear's order.
Shoot him.
Okay! Okay!
From behind, we see Danny bend slightly, dropping his pri cage. DANNY (cont'd) (eyeing the wild rodent) Oh my God ... oh-my-fucking-God ...
Danny tries to stay calm, shoots another look at Little B standing right next to him.
Now get talkin'
I didn't fucking do anything! I swear to God!
Pooh-Bear leans forward and opens the Plexiglas partition inch. THE WEASEL bolts for the opening, gnashing its teeth, try through.
You got something to tell Captain Steubing, you'd better do it now.

The weasel squirms and squeals and bangs against the Plex Danny uses the diversion.  He quickly TAKES SOMETHING fro jacket pocket and SLIPS IT IN THE HOLE IN LITTLE BILL'S J the coat and the lining. No one notices. Pooh-Bear opens the Plexiglas even more.  The weasel is a head through the hole.  He bares his filthy teeth.
(rapid-fire) Captain Steubing, listen to me. You're after the wrong guy. This is the fuck you should be talking to.
He nods towards Little Bill.  Pooh-Bear cocks his head. DANNY (cont'd) Jimmy told me that Little Bill's been shorting Pooh-Bear ... settin' up his own stuff on the side.
That's a pack of discharge.
Danny now makes eye contact with Pooh-Bear, who listens i
It's true. Jimmy saw him flashing a pimp role at a bar the other night ... said he was dissin' your ass in front of one of your customers.
Pooh-Bear rises slowly.  Approaches the triumvirate. Danny keeps one eye on ... ... the weasel as it continues its assault on the opening
Man'll say a lot of thing when he's sporting weasel food for a pecker.
Damn straight.
Least I can do is check it out though.
Pooh-Bear pulls a chrome .45 from his waistband.
Can I pull my dick out now?
Pooh-Bear limply aims the .45 at Little Bill. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Big Bill Big Bill pats Little Bill down.
(holding up his arms) Go ahead. I got nothing to hide.
Big Bill checks all of Little Bill's pockets, coming up e The weasel has squeezed about a third of the way through
Can I pull my dick out?
Danny, panicked, eyes the hole in the pea coat.
He's clean.
Danny can't believe it.  But when Little Bill lowers his roll of cash protrudes from the hole. Pooh-Bear and Big Bill see it immediately.
What?
He follows their gaze to the cash.
CAN I PULL MY FUCKING DICK OUT?!
(eyes on Little Bill) Yeah.
Danny extracts himself from the cage just as ... ... the weasel bolts through the opening and springs for the cage.

Danny sitting at the kitchen table.  THE SCREAMS OF LITTL FROM THE OTHER ROOM. Danny is FIDDLING WITH SOMETHING UNDER THE TABLE when he BEAR APPROACHING. Danny finishes up, stuffing a roll of DUCT TAPE into his Pooh-Bear drops a zip-lock bag of METH on the table.
I ought to just call this whole thing off right now.
Don't do that. Please.  Or I'll kill you.  Please, Danny.
What the hell was that? Who told you I was five-0?
No one. It was just a test. I need to be sure of who I'm dealing with from time-to-time.
Pooh-Bear nudges the baggie towards Danny. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Take it easy.  You passed.
Danny hands over the bundle of cash. Pockets the dope.
Did it ever occur to you that someone might cop to something they didn't do rather than have their balls chewed off by a rabid weasel?
I'll keep that in mind.
MOVE UNDER THE TABLE - Danny's Glock taped to the undersi sight.
Danny, Garcetti and Tanner.  Tanner doing a chemical test with a field kit.  The tester turns a tell-tale blue.
We're in business.
Good work, Flynne.  You're a first-rate rat.
That's real sweet, Garcetti.  Thanks.
We got the 411 on your good old boy.

Tanner produces a print out from an F.B.I criminal comput MUG SHOT OF BUBBA.  The name BUFORD "BUBBA" NGUYEN undern TANNER (cont'd) Nothing local so we ran his prints through the F.B.I. Believed to be a major supplier in Texas.  Jumped bail on a murder rap last April.
Murder.  Beautiful.
Pumped fifty-seven bullets into a police informant.
Danny heaves a sign and plops down on a bench.
You know, I'm starting to think I'd rather take my chances with Domingo than go through any more of this shit.
Didn't you hear?  Domingo's dead.
Danny looks up.
Took a pig-slicker to the heart.
Jesus.
I thought you'd be happy.
Yeah.
He doesn't look happy.
Domingo sprawled face-down on the tile floor of the showe leaking from underneath him.

head_text.subj: WATER PATTERS DOWN FROM THE SHOWER HEAD. DILUTING THE PO

text: The red car with "IFORGIV" plates parked in the driveway Spanish-style house.
NANCY AND VERNE PLUMMER watching TV. Photos of Liz on top of a baby grand piano.  A SHRINE OF CATHOLIC ICONS ABOUND: crucifixes, Virgin Mary's, needle A KNOCK ON THE DOOR.  Nancy gets up to answer.
Who is it?
It's Tom.
Nancy and Verne look at one another.
Danny and Verne sitting at the dining room table.  Nancy pot of coffee.  Verne eyes Danny silently.  Danny won't l eye.
All right, Nancy, how'd you track me down?
Billy Sutcliffe said he saw you at a bar down in Gardena a few weeks ago. Said you looked so bad, he barely recognized you.
Nancy pours the coffee. NANCY (cont'd) Billy's a cop now, you know.
Highway Patrol.
He said you were ... the people you  Were with ... well ...
Said you were a drug addict.
Maybe I should just go.
Danny pushes away from the table.  Nancy grabs Danny's wr
No. We want to help you, Tom.
Danny stays put. NANCY (cont'd) I know everyone deals with grief in their own way.  I know how hard it is to find closure.
Closure? How do you find closure when her killers are still running around out there?
I found forgiveness in my heart for the people who killed my daughter. I gave my grief to Jesus Christ.
Is that what you want me to do?  Put it all on Jesus?  Let him sort it out in the afterlife?
You've got to deal with this sooner or later, Tom. You can't keep hiding.
Maybe I am dealing with it.
I know it's not my place to pass judgement on you but ...
Danny looks at the shrine to Liz on top of the piano.
Then why don't I see any pictures Of me up there?
That was my idea.
You never did like me much, did you Verne? (beat) And you can't stand it that I walked out of there alive and Liz didn't. You think I'm a coward, don't you?

Verne's silence is answer enough. DANNY (cont'd) I don't blame you for hating me.  At least I understand that. (back to Nancy) But forgiving the butchers who killed Liz well I'm having some trouble with that one.
Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, a persecute you.
Danny touches Nancy's hand tenderly.
I'm genuinely happy that you found some peace, Nancy. But you can't forgive for Liz.  No one can.  And you can't forgive for me.
Your hatred makes them stronger and you weaker.

I don't buy that. There's a place for hatred. (beat) Did you know that Liz and I got into an argument the nigh she was killed? I acted like an ass and I never had a chance to apologize to her.  Do you know what that feels
It's not too late to show her you're sorry.
How?
Verne slams his hand down on the table.
By not disgracing her memory!
What does that mean?
You might as well be spitting on her grave every time you put drugs up your nose.  Or did you just conveniently forget that it was drug dealers who killed my daughter?
Verne glares at Danny.  No forgiveness in his heart. VERNE (cont'd) You ever think you might be buying drugs from the very people who took her life?
You don't understand.
Understand what?
Danny starts to say something.  Stops.
Nothing. It's ... it's complicated. I just want you to know ... I'm not what you think I am.
Danny sitting at a table, the lockbox open in front of hi He is endorsing the back of a life insurance check.  His driver's license laying next to it.
Who is it?
It's me.
I'm kind of busy.
Please open the door, Danny.
He pockets the check and the license, closes the lockbox to the door. Colette standing on the other side.  Her FACE AND ARMS AR BLUE WITH BRUISES.
Oh Jesus.
He lets her come in.  Colette looks away. DANNY (cont'd) Colette ... You've gotta leave.
We been through that.
What about a battered woman's shelter? You can move you kid in with you.
I need my paycheck.
You can still work.
He knows where I work.
Find a new job.
It's not that easy. I just got a raise. I need the money.
You always been this stubborn?
Colette cracks a crooked smile.
From day one. (beat) I was a breach birth. They tried for hours to turn my little butt around. But I wouldn't let 'em.
Ass first into the world.
I been that way ever since.
Danny smiles.  He gently touches her eye.  Colette reache touches Danny's bruised eye. COLETTE (cont'd) Look at us.  What a pair.
Colette leans in to kiss him, but they bump bad eyes.
Ouch. They laugh.
Can we try that again?
They kiss again.  Deep and long.  Danny suddenly pulls ba
I can't.
Colette goes to touch him. He pulls away. DANNY (cont'd) I can't.
Why not?
I just can't. Okay?
Danny paces uncomfortably.
What's wrong, Danny?
Look, maybe you oughta' leave.
No. I want to know what the hell is going on.
I can't tell you.
Colette comes to a slow realization.
There's someone else, isn't there?
THE FLASHBACK IMAGERY suddenly FLICKERS TO LIFE on the wa Danny - THE MOONLIGH SALTON SEA. Danny freezes.  Looks up at Colette.
Yes.
Colette waits a beat, then turns to leave. DANNY (cont'd) Don't go. (beat) Please, Colette. (she stops) Stay and talk to me, please.
Something about Danny's voice - a raw vulnerability - whi seen in him before.  MOVE OFF of Danny and ONTO THE FLASH
I'm so tired of lying.
Danny's car parked out front.
A CHUBBY GUY sitting on the couch in his underwear, watch WESTERN.  He sits there with wide eyes, GRINDING HIS JAWS Danny, Liz AND BO, the affable owner of the house, lookin the kitchen table.
What you want to do is go back the way you came and make a left at the bottom. It'll take you right to the highway.
That's it?
Are you Australian?
No.
Good. I fucking hate Australians.
Danny and Liz share a look.
You got a bathroom I can use before we hit the road?
Yeah? First door on the right. It ain't that dirty.  Just kinda' filthy is all.
(to Liz) You mind?
No, I don't mind.  That's how come I told you about it.
I was talking to my wife.
Try to make it fast.
Danny heads down the hallway, Liz looks a little uncomfor LIZ (cont'd) (trying to make small talk) So.  What do you do for a living around here?
You know. This and that.

head_text.subj: ON THE SHELVES, SUNDRY ITEMS USED TO DISTILL METH.

text: Bo scratching his arms. Liz notices TRACK MARKS ALL OVER BO'S ARMS.  He sees her
Skeeters. They're bad up here.
Danny peeing WHEN HE HEARS ANOTHER CAR PULL UP OUTSIDE. AND CLOSE.  HUSHED VOICES  OUTSIDE THE BATHROOM WINDOW. Danny finishes up.  He steps up onto the tub and peaks ou window.

head_text.subj: THE CAR. THE ENGINE REMAINS RUNNING.

text: Danny frowns, not sure what to make of it.  He steps down and is just about to exit when THE FRONT DOORS IS KICKED ARE FIRED. VOICES SHOUTING. Danny freezes, not sure what to do. His eyes dart around He picks up a large plumber's wrench and goes to the bath MORE SHOTS.  SEMI-AUTOMATIC FIRE. SEVERAL BULLETS slam through the bathroom wall, one strik the shoulder. He slumps to the floor. THE PANDEMONIUM continues in the front room. There is a BULLET HOLE about the size of a fifty cent pie next to Danny's head.  He puts his eye to the hole and lo DANNY'S P.O.V. THROUGH THE HOLE - scanning the room.  Sto ... LIZ. In the confusion, she has managed to hide from t She is squeezed into a tiny space between the sofa and th clings tightly to the curtains, her hands shaking violent ONE THE CURTAIN RINGS - pulled taught by Liz's grip. Danny adjusts his gaze through the hole. THROUGH THE HOLE - scanning to the other side of the room other guy sprawled on the floor. INTRUDER ONE stands over his legs visible. BACK ON LIZ - scared to death, clinging to the curtains. The curtain rings are pulled to the breaking point.

Let's go! INTRUDER TWO emerges from the back carrying a small nylon start to head out the front door when ... ... one of the curtain rings breaks with a METALLIC "TING ON DANNY - freaking. His eyes shooting back to Liz. SILENCE. Listening. Then the CREAKING FOOTSTEPS of Intruder One approaching. eternity. Liz can't possibly see Danny through the hole but it look staring directly at him, her body rigid with fear. Danny grabs the wrench again.  Tries to get to his feet b down, either too weak from loss of blood or just plain sc hand is shaking violently. He looks through the hole again. THROUGH THE HOLE - Liz still staring at Danny. THE FOOTST at a agonizing slow pace, then stop. A GUN, ever so slowly, enters FRAME. EXTREME CLOSE UP on they widen. EXTREME CLOSE UP on Danny's eye peering through the hole. FIRED. His eye closes. ON DANNY-his mouth opens to scream BUT NOTHING COMES OUT. And with that it is all over. Danny tries to get to his feet again. Fails, His eyes flu silent except for A FAINT LIQUID SPATTERING. LONG SHOT-Back on the Salton Sea, placid and silvered wit
Danny and Colette face-to face- in profile, silhouetted b the sea.
She died knowing that I was a coward... that I didn't lift a finger to help her.
There was nothing you could have done.
She is inches closer to him.
No, you're wrong, I tried to tell  myself the same thing but I could have gotten up. I could have done  something.
They would have killed you too.
(finally looks her in the eye) Nothing could be worse then this  slow death I'm living now.
Colette puts her arms around him and hugs him tight. The SEA FLICKERS AND FADES behind them. CLOSE ON DANNY-holding Colette.
(looking up) Colette...I want to help  you, with Quincey.
Colette pulls back.
No Danny, Don't- DANNY (cont'd) But you gotta be serious about it.
Really, I don't want to.
I want to do this for you.  I  want to do something good  for a change.
Danny goes over to the dresser. Takes out a baggie of met DANNY (cont'd) I want you to hide this somewhere where Quincy won't find it.
What is it?
Never mind. Just do what I say. He holds out the baggie. Colette backs away.
I don't want to.
Danny stalks her.

I'm offering you the chance to take  care of your problems. Take it. (she still hesitates) Don't make the same mistake I did, Colette. Do something while you  have a chance. Do it for your daughter  before something happens. (beat) Believe me, you don't want to  live with this burden. (firm) He helds the baggie out again. Colette  reluctantly takes it from him. DANNY (cont'd) Tommorrow night, when he is asleep.  I want you to beep me at this number. He writes the number down on a dollar bill.
Will you do that? (off her nod) Then I want you to get out of the room.
Why?
Don't worry about it. Just go across  the street and watch. You'll know  when it's safe to go back.
Colette goes to protest. Danny puts his hand to her mouth she did to him earlier.
Just do it. All your problems with  Quincey will be taken care of.
Empty except for Danny and Jimmy in a back booth. Danny s envelope over to Jimmy.
What's this?
Tem thousand dollars. Everything I could spare. (beat) It's for you.
But why? You only owe me five. And  that's not till after we close the deal tonight.
You aren't coming with me.
Jimmy looks hurt. DANNY (cont'd) I need you to do me a favor instead.
Okay
Wait till I tell you what it is.
It don't matter. I'll do it. And you sure as hell don't have to pay me.
Jimmy slides the money back over.
Why?
You're my best friend, man. I'd do  anything for you.
Danny smiles, genuinely touched.
Jimmy, look, there's something I have to tell you.
Hey, check it out...
Jimmy rolls his sleeve up, revealing a tattoo.
What the hell is that?
(Proudly) It's you! I didn't have a picture or nothin' so I had to describe you to the guy. Not bad though, huh?
Jimmy sits there, admiring the tattoo. Danny stares at Jimmy with pity. DANNY (cont'd) I really have to tell you something. It's important.
What?
I'm not a tweaker. (beat) I don't use drugs. I never had.
Danny is deadpan.  Jimmy starts laughing DANNY (cont'd) I'm not joking.
Jimmy keeps laughing. Danny staring, deadpan, Jimmy slowl laughing.
But...I've seen you.
When? When did you ever see me use?
This isn't like that Queen Elizabeth question, is it?
You ever notice how I always showed  up, in the middle of a binge? Left  before it was over? How I sneak away  for cap-naps? How when the crank  came around to me, I always said I'd  just done one?
Jimmy slack-jawed. DANNY (cont'd) You asked me how I always keep my  shit together. Well, that's how.
No one ever noticed?
Are you kidding me? A bunch of amped -out tweakers? It was easy.
Jimmy is agitated and confused.
But... why? Why would you pretend?
I can't tell you.
You don't trust me?
I don't trust anybody.
And you want me to do you some big favor? DANNY (cont'd) It's cool. I understand Danny gets up to leave.
Wait (beat) If you don't trust me, why did you  tell me that stuff about not using drugs?
Because I don't want to see you end  up like Kujo and those other losers. (beat) I thought that maybe if you knew that  I didn't use, you might see it in  yourself to go clear.

head_text.subj: EXT. BACK OF CINDERBLOCK BAR- DAY, (LATER)

text: Jimmy and Danny squinting in the mid-morning sun. They st face.
You mad at me, Jimmy?
Jimmy shrugs.
I don't know... a little. I wish you  would have let me in on it from the  beginning.
I'm sorry. I couldn't.
Danny taps Jimmy's arm.
You know you can get that tattoo removed, don't you.
Jimmy rubs his arm where the tattoo is.
Nah... I want to keep it. (beat) Maybe I can use it for like, inspiration ...you know...like when I detox?
Good for you Jimmy.
Danny takes the envelope from his pocket.
I really want you to take this.
Danny tries to hive Jimmy the envelope. Jimmy pushes it a
Wouldn't be a favor if you were  paying me. I'll just take my five  when the deal is done.
You're a good man. Jimmy the Finn.
Tanner and Garcetti's car parked on the periphery.
Danny in the back seat dialing a CELL PHONE. A MICRORECEI TO THE PHONE. Tanner and Garcetti listening through earpieces.
BUBBA answers a cell phone on the other end.
Yeah.
Everything go?
Yeah.
Just make sure you come alone. This  guy won't like any surprises
I ain't a idiot, asshole.
I'll see you tonight.

No!
